em, belief is not a requisite for this research. The question of mental com=
petency can only be answered after evaluation by a qualified psychologist. =
If a person is neglectful or abusive then a child could be removed. Social =
workers usually work under the license of a state certified psychiatrist (w=
ho is an MD) and has=A0to give the final=A0diagnosis of=A0the subject. The =
social worker can provide therapy, recommendations and such but cannot cert=
ify a person incompetent.

Its not as easy as it looks to take a child away=
 from thier mother and father. Technically, everything is supposed to be fa=
ir when it comes to this subject but in a lot of cases it is not. That depe=
nds on how well connected the social services person is and how good of a l=
awyer you have. Ultimately, even the psychiatrist has to present evidence a=
nd recommendations to a judge who makes it official.

To answer the questio=
n whether a child would be removed from parents who research ITC; highly un=
likely!

Regards,

Frank R.
